description: One-minute skill: Argument Mapping: Visualizing Logical Structure.

buildup.text: Argument mapping: visually representing claims, premises, objections, and supporting evidence as a structured diagram.

discovery.text: Tim van Gelder's research: students trained in argument mapping improved critical thinking 4x faster than those in.

twist.text: Maps reveal what text hides: circular reasoning, unsupported leaps, & missing premises become immediately visible in.

climax.text: Intelligence analysts, legal teams, & policy makers use argument mapping for complex decisions where verbal analysis.

punchline.text: You can't see the flaws in an argument you can't see.

quiz.question: Why is argument mapping effective for improving critical thinking?
options: It makes logical structure visible, revealing hidden flaws like circular reasoning
